result.execSummary:
The defendant Darryl N Hampton was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Battery, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Pay costs within 1 year; civil judgment to be entered for non payment.

With Huber.
Standard release.
Consecutive to: sentence currently serving

Defendant Darryl N Hampton in court, in custody, with attorney Robert J Penegor.   Timothy Suha appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
State filed Amended Information. Defendant entered a plea of guilty to the amended charge. Court conducted plea collouqy with defendant.
Court found defendant guilty to the amended charge.

The defendant was sentenced to the following:

JAIL 90 days, w/Standard Release Conditions; consecutive to sentence currently serving. 

FCOSTS: $243.00 to be paid within 1 year. If not paid convert to a civil judgment.

.

Defendant Darryl N Hampton in court, in custody, with attorney Robert J Penegor.   Melissa Zilavy appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Attorney Penegor advised court that the defendant is willing to take the State's offer, but he needs time to go over the plea form.
Court sets matter for plea.   Bail remains as fixed. 
Defendant to remain in the jail until after plea haering on April 8, 2016.
Plea hearing scheduled for April 8, 2016 at 10:00 am.
